case_title: AZIZ-UR-REHMAN vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR AND ANOTHER
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondant: Azad Government of the State of Jammu and Kashmir

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Hanif
allegation: Improper transfer from Rural Development Programme Department to Agricultural Department
Promotion from grade 5 to grade 16 without proper procedure

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the transfer and promotion of Muhammad Hanif from Rural Development Programme Department to Agricultural Department, alleging procedural irregularities.
investigation_summary: The appellant filed a departmental appeal on 1st December 1977, which was rejected on 18th April 1979. The Service Tribunal appeal was filed on 12th June 1979, within the prescribed limitation period.
judgment_summary: The appeal was dismissed on grounds of incompetence and unappealability. The Tribunal found that the transfer order did not affect the appellant's terms of service and was not legally appealable.
legal_arguments: Departmental appeal was filed beyond the prescribed limitation period.
Impugned order was not appealable under law as it was a transfer order and not a promotion order.
sections: Section 4, proviso (b)(i) of Service Tribunal Act, 1975

key_points.impugned_order_nature: Transfer order, not appealable under law
key_points.legal_basis: Service Tribunal Act, 1975 (Proviso b(i) to Section 4)

legal_terms.time-barred: A legal claim or appeal that is not filed within the prescribed time limit.
legal_terms.unappealable: A decision or order that cannot be challenged through an appeal.

words_and_phrases.impugned order: The order being challenged in a legal proceeding.

summary_vector_notes: The appellant challenged the transfer and promotion of Muhammad Hanif, alleging procedural irregularities. The Service Tribunal dismissed the appeal, citing time-barred departmental remedies and unappealability of the transfer order under the Service Tribunal Act, 1975.
